Lack of evidence: The expert notes that Scott Baio, the person making the claim, did not provide any evidence to support the assertion that Chelsea Clinton is married to George Soros' nephew. This lack of evidence casts doubt on the authenticity of the claim.
Contradictory information: The expert points out that Chelsea Clinton and Marc Mezvinsky were actually married at a different location, Astor Courts, which is not owned by George Soros. This contradicts Baio's claim that they were married at Soros' mansion, further undermining the credibility of the assertion.
Falsehood of the claim: The expert states that the claim that Marc Mezvinsky is the nephew of George Soros is demonstrably untrue. George Soros only has two nephews, Peter Soros and Jeffrey Soros, neither of whom is named Marc Mezvinsky or married to Chelsea Clinton. This clear contradiction exposes the falsehood of the claim.
Confirmation from family members: The expert cites Norton Mezvinsky, Marc's uncle, who explicitly stated that he is Marc's only uncle and was not invited to his nephew's wedding. This confirmation from a family member further refutes the claim that Marc Mezvinsky is related to George Soros and married to Chelsea Clinton.
